news_header: 2024 was the hottest year on record, with global temperatures surpassing 1.5°C above preindustrial levels.
news_text: The year 2024 marked a significant milestone as it was the hottest year recorded, with an average global temperature of 15.10°C, exceeding 1.5°C above preindustrial levels for the first time. This increase in temperature has led to unprecedented heat and extreme weather events worldwide. The report from the European Union’s Copernicus Climate Change Service highlighted that July 22, 2024, was particularly notable, reaching a global average temperature of 17.16°C. The findings emphasize the urgent need to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to mitigate the risks associated with climate change.
